intro: Sonchus oxyspermus, commonly known as the sharpleaf sowthistle, is a flowering plant in the dandelion family (Asteraceae). It is native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia and is characterized by its hairy, lobed leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, and it is often considered a weed in agricultural settings. The species is also known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies.
